alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 9:48PM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Blizzard Conditions Continue Tonight West of the Mississippi River... .White-out conditions continue to be reported west of the Mississippi. No travel advisories have been issued for northern Iowa. East of the Mississippi River, strong winds continue to result in localized drifting of snow over roadways and brief white-out conditions. Many county roads remain closed across Grant County. Wind chills remain bitterly cold with values of 30 to 35 degrees below zero. Frostbite can occur in as little as 30 minutes in these conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Wind chill values of 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Crawford County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
